result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Candice M Townsend

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Candice M Townsend in court.  Attorney James Edgar Toran in court for Candice M Townsend.  
Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
Status conference held.  Atty. Toran requests a final pretrial and trial date.  Court orders any pretrial documents be filed no later than 48 hours before the final pretrial date. Case is adjourned to Br. 1.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 17, 2023 at 09:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for January 30, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Candice M Townsend appeared by video.  Attorney James Edgar Toran appeared by video for Candice M Townsend.  
Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
OFF THE RECORD.  Hearing held via Zoom.  Status conference held.  Atty. Toran has not received discovery or an offer and requests a status conference date. Case is adjourned to Br. 1.
Status conference scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Candice M Townsend in court.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Hearing held via zoom. Status conference held. SPD has not yet appointed counsel. Case is adjourned in Branch 01.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Status conference scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Candice M Townsend in court.  Katrina Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Hearing held via Zoom.  Pretrial conference held. Defendant stated she was retaining Attorney Chernin.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Case adjourned to Br. 1.  Status conference scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 07-10-2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with TT. 
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Candice M Townsend in court.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible.  
The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 1.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7-8-2022 @2:30p
